definition[0]: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise
example[0]: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
definition[1]: to make a woman give birth to her baby, by giving her a special drug
example[1]: She had to be induced because the baby was four weeks late.
example[2]: The doctor decided to induce labour.
definition[2]: to cause a particular physical condition
example[3]: Patients with eating disorders may use drugs to induce vomiting.
definition[3]: to make someone decide to do something, perhaps something that seems unwise
example[5]: Lower interest rates would induce customers to borrow more.
